intro: Chytraculia cephalantha, commonly known as the helmet fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, helmet-shaped spore cases that are prominently displayed on the underside of its fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its fronds are usually elongated and have a leathery texture, with a dense covering of tiny spore-producing structures. The botanical features of Chytraculia cephalantha make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and taxonomic contexts.
